description:
## Theory
Mapping RDF in SIoTRx is as easy as writting a template with the format of the RDF file to get. In the case of mapping subjects, the triplet is written using a print to complete the URI of the resource. For example:
```
<#assign variable=resourceId>
<http://sample.com/resource/[=variable]> a <http://sample.com/class#Class> .
```
## Hands-on
### Task
The variable *people* contains the data from the CSV. Generate subjects with an URL that is http://sample.com/resource/P{ID} and which class is foaf:Person. Remember to use built-in functions to parse the data.
### CSV file content
| ID | Name | Phone | City |
|--|--|--|--|
| 1 | "Lily Dickens" | 585-610-2352 | Oneonta |
| 2 | "Chadd Sporer" | +1-352-334-0992 | Iowa |
| 3 | "Katharina Kuvalis" | (272) 642-0684 | Alberta |
| 4 | "Wilhelmine Johns III" | 574.747.4829 | Bock |
| 5 | "Sofia Rowe" | +15204328362 | Elmhurst |
solution_template:
<#assign people=providers("HttpProvider", { "method" : "GET", "url" : "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/ldac/people.csv"})>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
<#assign peopleRows = people?trim?split("\n")>
<#list peopleRows as personRow>
<#if !personRow?is_first>
<#assign personColumns = personRow?split(",")>
<http://sample.com/resource/[=personColumns[0]]> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person> .
</#if>
</#list>
